body_html:
The current patch does several things:

  1. It fixes @floringogianu's example, because manual_seed no longer calls is_available, and the CUDA seeding functions are now lazy, so the driver won't get initialized

  2. It improves the error message when the CUDA driver was initialized, but we didn't notice it from PyTorch

I think this should be "good enough" for most people.

body:
The current patch does several things:

1. It fixes @floringogianu's example, because manual_seed no longer calls `is_available`, and the CUDA seeding functions are now lazy, so the driver won't get initialized

2. It improves the error message when the CUDA driver was initialized, but we didn't notice it from PyTorch

I think this should be "good enough" for most people.
